text: Backlog from GBBF 2016 day 1, on cask, amber with a big tropical fruit nose. Hoppy-sweet with more fruit notes. Earthy bitterness and orange.
GBBF 2016. Pours a clear gold colour with a small fluffy white head, aroma is all tropical fruit, the taste is light bitterness with a dry bitter finish.

GBBF2016. clean golden color with small white head. Aroma is tangy crispy hoppy with notes of melon and lemon peel. Taste is also tangy citric with more lemon and grass notes. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, good one
(En fût/cask à la source): Floral, agrumes tranchants, corps svelte, malts craquants peu sucrés et une engouffrabilité hors norme.
Cask at the brewpub. Hazy gld with lace. Nicely hoppy nose, oranges, peaches. Good hop flavor, smooth malts, really tasty and rich. Very nice.
Sampled @ GBBF day 1. Clear orange to light amber color, small white to off-white head. Smell and taste some malts, nicely hoppy, tropical fruit hops, pineapple, piney, moderately bitter. Quite nice.

Gravity at The GBBF, London. A hazy amber colour with a frothy white head. Aroma of orange, grapefruit, some mango, slight pine, toasted malts, a little caramel and subtle grassy hops. Taste of orange, grapefruit, mango, some peach, slight pine, toasted malts, a little caramel and subtle spicy, grassy hops. Medium bodied and an oily texture. A dryish, toasted malt, citrus hop bitterness in the finish. I think a bog standard American pale ale overall but very fruity, a good malt backbone and hint of pine throughout. Little sweet at times but decent.

Cask at GBBF 2016 09/08/2016. A hazed copper amber coloured pour with a loose off white head. Aroma is sweet tangerine, orange, mango. Candied orange. Flavour is composed of sweet candied orange mango, tangerine, peach, peach cobbler. Palate is semi sweet moderate carbonation, ok.
Gbbf. Klares orange goldenes Bier. Geruch nach rotem malz, leicht zitronig hopfig. Geschmack mild hopfig, zitronig, Karamell, etwas wässrig.
Cask at the GBBF 2016.. Amber.. M thin white lacing... Soft zesty toffee fruit.. Soft sweet nose.. Soft woody toffee fruit

Cask gravity at GBBF 2016. Tropical fruit aroma. Ok condition. Like fruit salad chews from being a kid. Enjoyable. Could be in better nick. But the hop us fresh as hell. Nothing like an English Pale Ale though.

On tap at the brewery. Clear orange appearance with a white head. Bright, fresh, hop-forward aroma with citrus zest, floral notes and light tropical fruitiness. Similar flavor, adding mild hop bitterness and a light toasted grain sweetness. Light to medium body, crisp, clean and easy to drink. Nice.

On cask at Hops and Pie poured a clear tarnished gold with a small lasting creamy white head. Aromas of straw, tropical fruit, citrus and light earthiness. Palate was light bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of biscuit, pink grapefruit, light tropical fruit and a hint of yeast with a smooth dry lingering bitter finish.

Clear brilliant deep golden with a thin sticky white cap. Lovely leafy and grassy noble hop aroma with some slight earthiness and a touch of toasty and grassy/leafy sweetness. Smooth and crisp English flavor with clean pale malt and a sweet undertone with a mild grassy and leafy resiny fresh hop flavor. Nice earthy fresh hoppy flavors but with low bitterness letting the lean pale malt shine through. Really nice.
